SENT.plain: The majority of abdominal aortic aneurysms are the result of atherosclerosis
Cystic medial necrosis is a pathologic finding classically associated with thoracic aortic dissection, particularly in patients with Marfan's syndrome
The presence of cystic medial necrosis in other segments of the aorta or its branches is unusual
We report a case of a ruptured abdominal aortic aneurysm in a 38-year-old woman without Marfan's syndrome
